<!-- related story headlines starts -->
<!-- related story headlines ends -->
<p><strong>OSCEOLA COUNTY, Fla.</strong> - A ruptured water main has forced the Toho Water Authority to issue a precautionary boil water alert.</p>
<p>Repairs to the pipe could take until midnight Tuesday, the water authority said in a press release.</p>
<p>The boil water alert is for residents located off of Pleasant Hill Road from Harbor Road to North Seward Street. Residents in the Eagle Lakes subdivision and Pleasant Hill Lakes subdivision are serviced by a separate water plant and not affected by the boil water alert, officials said.</p>
<p>Residents might experience low water pressure and water outages while repairs are being made, the water authority said.</p>
<p>The water authority sent the following information for those affected by the water alert:</p>
<p>Once water is restored residents should boil their water prior to consumption (drinking, cooking, making ice, brushing teeth or washing dishes) as a precautionary measure.  A vigorous boil for one minute is adequate to render water bacteriologically safe for drinking. As an alternative bottled water may be used. The boil water alert will be in effect until a bacteriological survey shows that the water is safe to drink at which time the boil water alert will be lifted (rescinded) by Toho Water Authority. </p>
<p> </p>
<p>Under a precautionary boil water notice, water used for consumption can be disinfected by any one of the following methods:</p>
<ul>
<li>Bringing the water to a rolling boil and holding it there for one (1) minute</li>
<li>Using a disinfecting chemical. If you cannot boil water, you should put eight (8) drops of common household bleach which is about 1/8<sup>th</sup> teaspoon, into one (1) gallon of tap water, then shake it, and allow it to stand for 30 minutes before drinking. If the water is cloudy, use sixteen (16) drops, about 1/4<sup>th</sup> teaspoon of bleach instead of 8, shake it, and let it stand for 30 minutes. There should be a slight chlorine odor. Use common household bleach that has 5% to 6% active ingredients. Use food grade containers. Don’t use bleach that has perfume scents added.         </li>
<li>Using water purification tablets or iodine that many sports and camping stores sell</li>
<li>You can also buy commercial bottled water for consumption and food preparation.</li>
</ul>
<p> </p>
<p>Consumption includes brushing teeth, washing fruits and vegetables, and homemade ice. Tap water may be used for showering, baths, shaving and washing, so long as care is taken not to swallow or allow water in eyes or nose or mouth. Children and disabled individuals should have their baths supervised to ensure water is not ingested. The time spent bathing should be minimized. Though the risk of illness is minimal, individuals who have recent surgical wounds, are immunosuppressed, or have a chronic illness may want to consider using bottled or boiled water for cleansing until the notice is lifted.</p>
<p>For more information, please contact Toho Water Authority at (407) 944-5000.</p>
<p> </p>
<p> </p>

Cayuga/Aurelius boil-water order lifted

  • The Citizen staff
  • Jan 29, 2013
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email
  • Print
  • Save

The boil water order that had been in place for the Village of Cayuga and the Town of Aurelius Water District #3 has been lifted.

The Cayuga County Health Department said Tuesday that District #3 water customers no longer had to follow precautions before drinking their water.

The boil water order had been in effect since high winds and freezing temperatures Jan. 13 created large waves on Cayuga Lake that churned the lake so that sediment kicked up and interfered with the water system's intake pipe, where water is drawn from Cayuga Lake prior to purification.

Boil order issued for parts of Lynnville

There's a boil advisory in effect for Lynnville water customers.

The utility says neighbors who live in the area of Old Dam Road West, to the sewage lift station that is on Highway 68, north of Highway 68 to the lake.

This includes all of Mead Valley Subdivision.

Residents are asked to boil water for five minutes before drinking or cooking. 

No word on when it will be lifted.

    function fetchWeather(zip) {
        var fetch = $.ajax({
            url: '/api/rest/audiencero/weather/zipcode/' + zip
        })
        return fetch;
    }

    function renderWeather(weatherZipCode) {
        fetchWeather(weatherZipCode).done(function(data){
            try {
                var obj = {
                    weather: data.data[0]
                }
                $('.sd-weather-current-icon').removeClass('wi-stk-97').addClass('wi-stk-'+obj.weather.forecast.current.iconCode);
                $('.sd-weather-current-temp').text(obj.weather.forecast.current.tempF);
                $('.weather-current >.no-margin .wx-temp').text(obj.weather.forecast.current.tempF).append('<i class="wi wi-degrees"/>');
                $('.wx-icon-text >.wx-icon >.wi').removeClass('wi-97').addClass('wi-'+obj.weather.forecast.current.iconCode);
                $('.wx-icon-text >.wx-text').text(obj.weather.forecast.current.skyText);
                $('.wx-container').css('opacity',1)
            } catch (e){
                console.log(e)
            }
        })
    }

    $('#sd-desktop-search').on('keydown',function(){
        if($(this).val().length >= 3) {
            $(this).siblings('button').addClass('search-active');
        } else {
            $(this).siblings('button').removeClass('search-active');
        }
    })

    renderWeather('43953')

<div class="ndn-container p402_hide">
<div class="ndn_embed" data-config-distributor-id="90319" data-config-height="9/16w" data-config-width="100%" id="ndn-video-player-2"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">var _ndnq = _ndnq || []; _ndnq.push(['embed']);</script>

<p>CHARLESTON, W.Va. -- West Virginia American Water and the town of Ronceverte has issued boil-water advisories.A boil-water advisory that West Virginia American Water issued earlier this morning for approximately 200 residential customers in the Campbells Creek Road and Blount areas of Kanawha County has been expanded to include approximately 1,000 customers in all. The advisory is now in effect for any customers in the Campbells Creek and Blount areas who have experienced low water pressure or a disruption in water service this morning. The advisory was issued following a water main breaks.The affected area includes Campbells Creek Road from 5 Mile Road/Coal Mine to the end, Eight Mile Hollow, Rattlesnake Hollow, Spruce Road, Campbell's Creek Drive from Younger Drive to the end, Younger Drive, Norman Drive, Rensford Star Route, Staton Drive, Coal Fork Drive, the first three-quarter miles of Clover Hollow, Point Lick Road, Hatfield Drive, Tower Drive, Cline Hollow Road, the Campbells Creek side of Big Bottom Road and Patterson Drive.A boil-water advisory has also been issued for all of Ronceverte's water customers.Customers in those areas should boil their water for at least one full minute prior to use until further notice.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-608361">
<div class="tnt-ads-container text-center ">
<div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-refreshable="true" id="ad-608361" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;">
<script>
                googletag.cmd.push(function() {
                    googletag.display('ad-608361');
                    
                });
            </script>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>

                            metric: obj.metric,
                            id: obj.uuid
                        });
                    }
                
            }
        }

            jQuery(__tnt.trackEventLater).each(function(){
                __tnt.trackEvent($(this));
            });

Boil water advisory has been lifted

January 29, 2013 By ACCV Editor

Share on Facebook Share
Share on TwitterTweet
Send To Devices Send

UPDATE: THE BOIL WATER ADVISORY HAS BEEN LIFTED

Date Issued: 1/28/13

Time Issued: 11:00 A.M.

A BOIL WATER ADVISORY is in effect for consumers of Columbia Adair

Utilities District for customers on Baker Street, Cole Street, Greensburg Street, Mack Street, Mitchell Street, Walker Street, Hudson Street up to Royal Manor Apt., Stults Street, Rice Drive, Watson Street, Crestview Street, Wall Street, Merchant Street, South High Street, North High Street, East Fortune Street and East Guardian Street.

The advisory has been issued due to a main line leak.

Following such an event, the potential exists for bacteriological contamination of the water supply therefore this Boil Water Advisory has been issued as a precautionary measure.

Until further notice, boil all water used for drinking and cooking, bringing the water to a rolling boil for three minutes before using.

This advisory will remain in effect until the situation has been corrected and test results have shown the water to be of an acceptable quality.
For more information concerning the Boil Water Advisory, contact Lennon Stone

at Columbia Adair Utilities District, 270-384-2181.

Boil-water advisory lifted in Pennfield Township near Battle Creek

Print Email
Ursula Zerilli | uzerilli@mlive.com By Ursula Zerilli | uzerilli@mlive.com The Kalamazoo Gazette
Follow on Twitter
on January 28, 2013 at 10:25 AM, updated January 28, 2013 at 10:27 AM
comments

PENNFIELD TOWNSHIP, MI — A boil-water advisory caused by a broken water main on Capital Avenue, issued on Saturday, has been lifted.

The area in which the advisory was in effect included properties on Park Street between Capital Avenue NE and Sharon Avenue, and all properties along Capital Avenue NE from Park Stree to Montford Street.

People in the area were advised to boil water for at least 1 minute before consuming it. Residents may call the township at 269-968-8549 after 8 a.m. Monday for more information. Water samples were to be taken Saturday evening for testing.

Richlands boil water advisory in effect

Monday
Feb 4, 2013 at 12:01 AM Feb 4, 2013 at 5:30 PM

Residents of Sylvester, Pete Jones and Mills streets and surrounding areas in Richlands are encouraged to boil water for consumption, according to a release from the Onslow Water and Sewer Authority.


Residents of Sylvester, Pete Jones and Mills streets and surrounding areas in Richlands are encouraged to boil water for consumption, according to a release from the Onslow Water and Sewer Authority.



Work to lines on Mills Street may cause low pressure and increase the possibility for back siphonage and bacteria entering into the water system.



The Division of Environmental Health suggests residents boil all water used for consumption or use bottled water. Vigorous boiling for one minute should kill any disease-causing organisms that may be present in the water, the release stated.

__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){

    var lastDate = new Date(__tnt.recent.date.get());
    
    expireDate = expireDate.getTime();
    lastDate = lastDate.getTime();
    
    if(Number(lastDate)<Number(expireDate)){
        __tnt.log("resetting restrictions");
        var nextDate = new Date(expireDate+(__tnt.metering.config.days * 86400000));

        __tnt.recent.count.set(0);
        __tnt.recent.date.set(nextDate.getTime());

        __tnt.log(nextDate);
    }
});

// Set the 'read' variable if the current asset is in the recent assets list
__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("checking whether user has read this before");
    
    var recent = __tnt.recent.assets.get();
    var uuid = __tnt.metering.config.uuid;
    
    var check = false;
    var i = 0;
    while(!check && i < recent.length){
        if(recent[i]==uuid){
            __tnt.log("found asset in recent");
            var check = true;
        }
        i++;
    }    
    
    if(check){
        __tnt.log("user has read this already");
        __tnt.metering.config.read = true;
    }else{
        __tnt.log("not read before");
    }
});

    var cleanedReferrer = String(String(window.document.referrer).split('?')[0]).replace(/https\:\/\/|http\:\/\//,'').replace(/www/,'');
    var check = false;
    
    $.each(sites,function(){
        var regexp = String(this).replace(/\./g,'\\.').replace(/\,/g,'|');

});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){

// increment counter on new assets

__tnt.metering.compatibility = function(){
    var compatible = true;
    var status = "";
    
    /* this checks for compatibility with DOM storage */
    try{

var bloxHasSubscription = false;
            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4471);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4470);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4472);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4455);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5603);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5281);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://globegazette.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });


    </script>

<a class="btn btn-default btn-xs" href="http://globegazette.mycapture.com/mycapture/remoteimage.asp?backtext=Return%20to%20photo&backurl=&thumbpath=https%3A%2F%2Fbloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com%2Fglobegazette.com%2Fcontent%2Ftncms%2Fassets%2Fv3%2Feditorial%2F0%2F33%2F033c83a2-a651-5184-957e-d8a7083344ed%2F510efa0e42d23.image.jpg%3Fresize%3D540%252C368&previewpath=https%3A%2F%2Fbloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com%2Fglobegazette.com%2Fcontent%2Ftncms%2Fassets%2Fv3%2Feditorial%2F0%2F33%2F033c83a2-a651-5184-957e-d8a7083344ed%2F510efa0e42d23.image.jpg%3Fresize%3D540%252C368&notes=https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/globegazette.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/0/33/033c83a2-a651-5184-957e-d8a7083344ed/510efa0f832d0.~townnews~.jpg&pricingsheetid=3059" target="_blank">Buy Now</a>
</div><div class="caption-text"><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Crews from Alliant Energy work on setting a couple of new power poles in Meservey late Sunday morning to restore electricity to the town. The poles were destroyed in an early morning fire that also destroyed two vacant buildings in the 400 block of First Street. One building formerly housed a cafe and the other building formerly housed a hardware store.</p>

<figcaption class="caption"><div class="actions pull-right">
<a class="btn btn-default btn-xs" href="http://globegazette.mycapture.com/mycapture/remoteimage.asp?backtext=Return%20to%20photo&backurl=&thumbpath=https%3A%2F%2Fbloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com%2Fglobegazette.com%2Fcontent%2Ftncms%2Fassets%2Fv3%2Feditorial%2F0%2F33%2F033c83a2-a651-5184-957e-d8a7083344ed%2F510efa0e42d23.image.jpg%3Fresize%3D540%252C368&previewpath=https%3A%2F%2Fbloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com%2Fglobegazette.com%2Fcontent%2Ftncms%2Fassets%2Fv3%2Feditorial%2F0%2F33%2F033c83a2-a651-5184-957e-d8a7083344ed%2F510efa0e42d23.image.jpg%3Fresize%3D540%252C368&notes=https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/globegazette.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/0/33/033c83a2-a651-5184-957e-d8a7083344ed/510efa0f832d0.~townnews~.jpg&pricingsheetid=3059" target="_blank">Buy Now</a>
</div>
<span class="caption-text">
<p>Crews from Alliant Energy work on setting a couple of new power poles in Meservey late Sunday morning to restore electricity to the town. The poles were destroyed in an early morning fire that also destroyed two vacant buildings in the 400 block of First Street. One building formerly housed a cafe and the other building formerly housed a hardware store.</p>
</span>
<span class="credit">
<span>JEFF HEINZ/The Globe Gazette</span>
</span>
</figcaption>
</figure></div>

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>MESERVEY — It will be at least Wednesday morning before Meservey residents are given the all-clear to stop boiling their water.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>A boil warning was put into effect after a fire Sunday morning which drained the city’s water tower. A power outage caused by the fire left the city unable to refill the tower.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/globegazette.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Power and water service were restored about 3 p.m. Sunday.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/globegazette.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>But residents have been advised to boil their water before drinking it.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/globegazette.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“Following the normal protocol any time you have a loss of pressure it basically allows for the possibility of contamination getting into the system,” said Iowa Department of Natural Resources spokesman Kevin Baskins.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>DNR environmental specialist Scott Wilson said a test was taken Monday. Two more tests will be taken today with the results coming Wednesday morning.</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

</div></div></div><script>
        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://globegazette.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=d3dffd0e-6f0b-11e2-ba11-001a4bcf887a&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://globegazette.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=d3dffd0e-6f0b-11e2-ba11-001a4bcf887a&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != 'd3dffd0e-6f0b-11e2-ba11-001a4bcf887a') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://globegazette.com/tncms/block/1405182/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

    var sites = ['lm.facebook.com','l.facebook.com','m.facebook.com','news.google.com','news.yahoo.com','facebook.com','twitter.com','t.co','fb.me','plus.google.com','goo.gl','google.com','yahoo.com','drudgereport.com','paid.outbrain.com','rma-api.gravity.com','fark.com','bing.com','tpc.googlesyndication.com','msn.com','reddit.com','hsrd.yahoo.com','aol.com','idrudgereport.com','search.tb.ask.com','aol.com'];
    
    var cleanedReferrer = String(String(window.document.referrer).split('?')[0]).replace(/https\:\/\/|http\:\/\//,'').replace(/www/,'');
    var check = false;
    
    $.each(sites,function(){
        var regexp = String(this).replace(/\./g,'\\.').replace(/\,/g,'|');
    
        if(String(cleanedReferrer).search(regexp)>-1){
            __tnt.log("User arrived from site, entry granted");
        
            check = true;
        }else{
        	__tnt.log("User arrived from other site, no special access");
        }
    });
    
    __tnt.metering.config.referred = check;
    return check;
});

// increment counter on new assets
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    // this will also need to check if the user has previously read the asset (by checking the swtich set by the init script.)
    if(!__tnt.metering.config.read){
        __tnt.log("incrementing counter");

        var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
        count++;
        __tnt.recent.count.set(count);

        // fire an event that will allow a one time only message for a given count
        $(window).trigger('__tnt.metering.new');
    }else{
        $(window).trigger('__tnt.metering.read');
    }
});

__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
    var limit = __tnt.metering.config.sub_limit;
    var remaining = (limit - count);

    if(count > limit){count = limit;}
    if(remaining < 0){remaining = 0;}

    var messageClass = 'access';
    if(__tnt.metering.config.referred){ messageClass = 'referred'; }
    if(__tnt.metering.config.read){ messageClass = 'read'; }

    var message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+'][data-registered=false]').first();
    if(__tnt.user.loggedIn){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+'][data-registered=true]').first(); }

    if(!message.length){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+']').first(); }

    if(!message.length && window.sessionStorage){
        if(sessionStorage.getItem('__tnt.metering.wall.viewed')=="1"){
            message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-registered=true][data-after-wall=true]').first();
        }
    }

    if(!message.length){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+':not([data-count]):not([data-after-wall])').first(); }

    if(message.length){
        __tnt.template(
            message,
            $('#asset-content').find('.asset-body'),
            true,
            [{
                'element': '.count',
                'html': count
            },{
                'element': '.total',
                'html': limit
            },{
                'element': '.remaining',
                'html': remaining
            }]
        );
    }

    if(__tnt.user.authToken){
        $('#asset-content').find('.meter.notification').find('.logged-in').show();
    }else{
        $('#asset-content').find('.meter.notification').find('.not-logged-in').show();
    }

    if(window.sessionStorage){
        sessionStorage.removeItem('__tnt.metering.wall.viewed');
    }

});

__tnt.metering.access.d.push(function(){

    $(lastPreview)
        .css({'position':'relative'})
        .append('<div class="redacted-overlay" style="position:absolute;bottom:0;left:0;width:100%;height:'+$(lastPreview).height()+'px;background: linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba('+bgColorRGB+',0), rgba('+bgColorRGB+',255) 80%);"></div>')
        .after('<div class="subscription-required"></div>');
    
    var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
    var limit = __tnt.metering.config.sub_limit;
    var remaining = (limit - count);
    
    if(count > limit){count = limit;}
    if(remaining < 0){remaining = 0;}
    
    var messageClass = 'subscription';
    if((count>=__tnt.metering.config.reg_limit)&&(count<__tnt.metering.config.sub_limit)){
        messageClass = 'registration';
    }
    
    var message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+'][data-registered=false]').first();

    if(!message.length){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+']').first(); }
    if(!message.length){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+':not([data-count])').first(); }

    if(message.length){
        var insertionPoint = $('#asset-content').find('.asset-body').find('.subscription-required');
        if(!insertionPoint.length){
            insertionPoint = $("#eedition-subscription");
        }
        if(!insertionPoint.length){
            if($('#asset-content').length){ if(!$('#asset-content').find('.asset-body').length){ $('#asset-content').prepend('<div class="asset-body"></div>'); } }
            $('#asset-content').find('.asset-body').prepend('<div class="subscriber-premium"><div class="subscription-required"></div></div>');
            insertionPoint = $('#asset-content').find('.asset-body').find('.subscription-required');

        __tnt.template(

            },{

                $(element).find("a[data-toggle=collapse]").each(function(){

                        $(this).on('click',function(){
                            var href = $(this).attr("href");

                            $(href).collapse('toggle');
                        });
                    }
                });
                
                if(!(__tnt.metering.compatibility().status == 'FAIL: no metering in eedition')){
                    if($("#template-metering").find('.metering-modal').length){
                        $("#template-metering").find('.metering-modal').modal();

                        });
                    }
                }
            }
        );

});

__tnt.metering.compatibility = function(){
    var compatible = true;
    var status = "";
    
    /* this checks for compatibility with DOM storage */
    try{
        window.sessionStorage.setItem('__tnt.compatibility',true);
    }catch(e){
        compatible = false;
        status = "FAIL: setItem unsupported";
    };
    if(!compatible){
        __tnt.log(status);
    }
    return {'check':compatible,'status':status};
};
var bloxHasSubscription = false;
            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5009);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5605);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4655);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4978);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4656);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4657);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5353);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4608);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://www.nwitimes.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });


    </script>

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>GRIFFITH | About 80 homes on Griffith's west side are under a boil order after a water main break caused water pressure to drop there Sunday afternoon.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Rick Konopasek, director of public works for Griffith, said crews were called around 2:30 p.m. for a water main break in a backyard in the 900 block of West Ash Street.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake/griffith" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Other utilities had to be called in to ensure no lines would be cut before Griffith crews could begin digging to repair the main, Konopasek said. Work on the main began after 6 p.m.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake/griffith" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>Water service was cut for less than an hour as crews repaired the break, he said.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake/griffith" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Residents on West Ash Street and Pine Place should boil their water before consuming it or use bottled water.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Konopasek said the earliest the boil order could be lifted would be by around noon Wednesday. He anticipates the order will be lifted then.</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1369863"><section class="block emphasis-h3 dark " id="block-1369863">

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=fa0b0d1c-4e6e-525a-ac5a-8494de74ae80&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=fa0b0d1c-4e6e-525a-ac5a-8494de74ae80&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != 'fa0b0d1c-4e6e-525a-ac5a-8494de74ae80') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/block/1429668/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

    var sites = ['lm.facebook.com','l.facebook.com','m.facebook.com','news.google.com','news.yahoo.com','facebook.com','twitter.com','t.co','fb.me','plus.google.com','goo.gl','google.com','yahoo.com','drudgereport.com','paid.outbrain.com','rma-api.gravity.com','fark.com','bing.com','tpc.googlesyndication.com','msn.com','reddit.com','hsrd.yahoo.com','aol.com','idrudgereport.com','search.tb.ask.com','aol.com'];
    
    var cleanedReferrer = String(String(window.document.referrer).split('?')[0]).replace(/https\:\/\/|http\:\/\//,'').replace(/www/,'');
    var check = false;
    
    $.each(sites,function(){
        var regexp = String(this).replace(/\./g,'\\.').replace(/\,/g,'|');
    
        if(String(cleanedReferrer).search(regexp)>-1){
            __tnt.log("User arrived from site, entry granted");
        
            check = true;
        }else{
        	__tnt.log("User arrived from other site, no special access");
        }
    });
    
    __tnt.metering.config.referred = check;
    return check;
});

// increment counter on new assets
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    // this will also need to check if the user has previously read the asset (by checking the swtich set by the init script.)
    if(!__tnt.metering.config.read){
        __tnt.log("incrementing counter");

        var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
        count++;
        __tnt.recent.count.set(count);

        // fire an event that will allow a one time only message for a given count
        $(window).trigger('__tnt.metering.new');
    }else{
        $(window).trigger('__tnt.metering.read');
    }
});

__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
    var limit = __tnt.metering.config.sub_limit;
    var remaining = (limit - count);

    if(count > limit){count = limit;}
    if(remaining < 0){remaining = 0;}

    var messageClass = 'access';
    if(__tnt.metering.config.referred){ messageClass = 'referred'; }
    if(__tnt.metering.config.read){ messageClass = 'read'; }

    var message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+'][data-registered=false]').first();
    if(__tnt.user.loggedIn){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+'][data-registered=true]').first(); }

    if(!message.length){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+']').first(); }

    if(!message.length && window.sessionStorage){
        if(sessionStorage.getItem('__tnt.metering.wall.viewed')=="1"){
            message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-registered=true][data-after-wall=true]').first();
        }
    }

    if(!message.length){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+':not([data-count]):not([data-after-wall])').first(); }

    if(message.length){
        __tnt.template(
            message,
            $('#asset-content').find('.asset-body'),
            true,
            [{
                'element': '.count',
                'html': count
            },{
                'element': '.total',
                'html': limit
            },{
                'element': '.remaining',
                'html': remaining
            }]
        );
    }

    if(__tnt.user.authToken){
        $('#asset-content').find('.meter.notification').find('.logged-in').show();
    }else{
        $('#asset-content').find('.meter.notification').find('.not-logged-in').show();
    }

    if(window.sessionStorage){
        sessionStorage.removeItem('__tnt.metering.wall.viewed');
    }

});

__tnt.metering.compatibility = function(){
    var compatible = true;
    var status = "";
    
    /* this checks for compatibility with DOM storage */
    try{
        window.sessionStorage.setItem('__tnt.compatibility',true);
    }catch(e){
        compatible = false;
        status = "FAIL: setItem unsupported";
    };
    if(!compatible){
        __tnt.log(status);
    }
    return {'check':compatible,'status':status};
};
var bloxHasSubscription = false;
            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5594);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4597);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4598);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4600);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://poststar.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });


    </script>

<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>FORT EDWARD -- The boil water order put in place in Fort Edward late last week after a water main break has been lifted, according to village officials.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>

<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>The boil-water notice was issued Friday for the Knolls, beginning at the intersection of Frederick Street and Samantha Drive, Andrew Lane, county Route 46, Drifting Ridge, Tori Trace and all of Water District II.</p>

                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://poststar.com/tncms/block/1421721/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

<meta content="BATTLE CREEK, Mich. — The city of Battle Creek has lifted a Boil Water Advisory for two areas after repairing a “significant water main leak.”

The city announced Sunday morning that its Water Division had repaired a significant water main leak east of the intersections of M-37 and M-89 in the Urbandale area. It then issued a Boil Water Advisory for the following two areas:" property="og:description"/>

<h1 class="entry-title">Boil Water Advisory Lifted in Battle Creek</h1>
<div class="entry-meta clearfix">
<span class="posted-time">Posted 8:08 AM, February 4, 2013, by <a class="author url fn" href="http://fox17online.com/author/hotman5890/" rel="author" title="Posts by hotman5890">hotman5890</a></span> </div>
<div class="entry-share">

<img class="print-logo visible-print" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/localtv-2/img/wxmi/logo-gray.png"/>
<div class="article-archived">This is an archived article and the information in the article may be outdated. Please look at the time stamp on the story to see when it was last updated.</div> <article class="post-17831 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-17831">
<div class="entry-content">
<p>BATTLE CREEK, Mich. — The city of Battle Creek has lifted a Boil Water Advisory for two areas after repairing a “significant water main leak.”</p>
<p>The city announced Sunday morning that its Water Division had repaired a significant water main leak east of the intersections of M-37 and M-89 in the Urbandale area. It then issued a Boil Water Advisory for the following two areas:</p>
<p>* On Michigan Avenue West from Bedford Road South to Dunning Avenue.</p>
<p>* On Hinman Avenue South from Michigan Avenue West to and including Bond Avenue.</p>
<p>The city announced that follow-up testing “has confirmed no coliform bacteria are present in the water supply,” according to a media release.</p>
</div>

<header class="entry-header">
<h1 class="entry-title">Battle Creek Issues Drinking Water Advisory</h1>
<div class="entry-meta clearfix">
<span class="posted-time">Posted 10:59 AM, February 3, 2013, by <a class="author url fn" href="http://fox17online.com/author/tribcarlgustin/" rel="author" title="Posts by Carl Gustin">Carl Gustin</a></span> </div>
<div class="entry-share">

<div class="article-archived">This is an archived article and the information in the article may be outdated. Please look at the time stamp on the story to see when it was last updated.</div> <article class="post-17699 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-17699">
<div class="entry-content">
<p>BATTLE CREEK, Mich. — The city of Battle Creek has issued a Boil Water Advisory for two areas after repairing a “significant water main leak.”</p>
<p>The city announced Sunday morning that its Water Division had repaired a significant water main leak east of the intersections of M-37 and M-89 in the Urbandale area. It then issued a Boil Water Advisory for the following two areas:</p>
<p>* On Michigan Avenue West from Bedford Road South to Dunning Avenue.</p>
<p>* On Hinman Avenue South from Michigan Avenue West to and including Bond Avenue.</p>
<p>The city is advising residents to boil water before using it for consumption. An announcement will be made when the Boil Water Advisory is lifted.</p>
<p> </p>
<p> </p>
</div>
